tn.text: Paul encourages Timothy to pray for all people.
"most important" or "before anything else"

tn.ref: I urge that requests, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings be made
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I urge all believers to make requests, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgiving to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"I plead" or "I ask"
Here "peaceful" and "quiet" mean the same thing. Paul wants all believers to be able to live calm lives without trouble from the authorities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"that honors God and that other people will respect"

tn.ref: He desires all people to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God desires to save all people and for them to come to the knowledge of the truth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: to come to the knowledge of the truth
tn.text: Paul speaks of learning the truth about God as if it were a place to which people could be brought. AT: "to know and accept what is true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: one mediator for God and man
tn.text: A mediator is a person who helps negotiate a peaceful settlement between two parties who disagree with each other. Here Jesus helps sinners enter into a peaceful relationship with God.
"died willingly"
"as a price of freedom" or "as a payment to obtain freedom"

tn.ref: as the testimony at the right time
tn.text: It can be made explicit that this was the testimony that God wants to save all people. AT: "as the proof at the right time that God wants to save all people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This means that this was the time that God had chosen.
"For this" or "For this reason"

tn.ref: I, myself, was made a herald and an apostle
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Christ made me, Paul, a preacher and an apostle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: I am a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth
tn.text: "I teach the Gentiles the message of faith and truth." Here, Paul may be using "faith" and truth" to express one idea. AT: "I teach the Gentile about the true faith" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hendiadys]])
Paul finishes his instructions on prayer then gives some special instructions for women.

tn.ref: I want men in every place to pray and to lift up holy hands
tn.text: Here "holy hands" means the entire person is holy. AT: "I want men in every place who are holy to lift up their hands and pray" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"the males in all places" or "the males everywhere." Here the word "men" refers specifically to males.
It was a normal posture for people to raise their hands while praying.

control** - Both of these words mean basically the same thing. Paul is emphasizing that women should wear clothes that are appropriate and do not attract improper attention from men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: They should not have braided hair
tn.text: During Paul's time, many Roman women braided their hair to make themselves attractive. Braiding is only one way a woman can give undue attention to her hair. If braided hair is unknown, it can be stated in a more general way. AT: "They should not have fancy hairstyles" or "They should not have elaborate hairstyle that attract attention" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

These are beautiful and valuable white balls that people use as jewelry. They are formed inside the shell of a certain kind of small animal that lives in the ocean. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

tn.ref: who profess godliness through good works
tn.text: "who want to honor God by the good things they do"
"in quietness"
"and not ask questions about what they hear" (UDB) or "ready to obey everything God commands"

tn.ref: I do not permit a woman
tn.text: "I do not allow a woman"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Adam is the one God formed first" or "God created Adam first" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The understood information can be stated clearly. AT: "then God formed Eve" or "then God created Eve" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "And Adam was not the one whom the serpent deceived" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: but the woman was completely deceived in transgression
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "but it was the woman who disobeyed because the serpent completely deceived her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: she will be saved through bearing children
tn.text: Here "she" refers to women in general. Possible meanings are 1) God will keep women physically safe as they give birth to children, or 2) God will save women from their sins through their role as child bearers.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will save her" or "God will save women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"if they remain" or "if they continue living." Here "they" refers to women.

tn.ref: in faith and love and sanctification
tn.text: "in trusting Jesus and loving others and living a holy life"
"with self-control" or "with awareness of what is best"
